person.persName: Thomas Johnson (Montgomery Co, KY, farmer, prov Congress, maj & lt col KY Mounted Rifles CSA)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky farmer, soldier, and politician. Kentucky native. Educated in the common schools. Married to Elizabeth Peters Johnson. Father of Albert Sidney Johnson, Pattie Johnson, Annie Johnson, and Susette Johnson. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Served in the Kentucky State Militia as a major general. Member of the Provisional Congress of the Confederate States of America in the winter of 1861 and 1862 for six weeks. Served in the 2nd Battalion Kentucky Mounted Rifles (C.S.A.) as major and lieutenant colonel from 1862 to 1865.
